name: Cleaving Through Creatures
description: When a melee attack reduces a creature to 0 Hit Points, any excess damage from that attack can carry over to another creature nearby. This variant rewards powerful melee combatants fighting groups of weaker enemies.

mechanics.trigger: A melee attack reduces a creature to 0 Hit Points and there is excess damage remaining

carryOver.requirement: The new target must be within the attacker's melee reach and adjacent to the original target
carryOver.acCheck: The new target's AC must be equal to or lower than the original target's AC
carryOver.damage: The excess damage is applied to the new target. If this also reduces the new target to 0 HP, the process repeats.

mechanics.attackRoll: No new attack roll is required. The original attack roll is compared against the original target only; excess damage transfers automatically if the new target's AC qualifies.
limitations: Only applies to melee attacks, not ranged or spell attacks
The new target must have equal or lower AC than the original target
The new target must be within the attacker's reach and adjacent to the original
Damage resistances and immunities of the new target still apply to the carried-over damage

interactions: Great Weapon Master and other high-damage melee builds become significantly more effective against groups of low-HP creatures
This rule most commonly triggers when fighting swarms of weaker enemies (e.g., a high-level fighter cleaving through goblins)
Critical hit bonus damage can contribute to the excess that carries over
Damage types carry over (e.g., if the original attack dealt fire damage via a Flame Tongue, the excess damage is still fire damage)
Effects that trigger on reducing a creature to 0 HP (such as relentless rage or a vorpal sword) may interact with each creature dropped
